catalog_info.title: Post WW-II Architecture and the 'Crisis in Culture'
catalog_info.description: This seminar addresses the work of key figures of postwar architecture in relation to major philosophical and political themes of the period: discourses on beauty and democracy, humanism and monumentality, mass culture and camp, religion and technology, as well as the relationship between ancient civilizations and modern ideals. Particular focus on the conflicted legacies of American architects such as Bunshaft, Stone, and Johnson and writings by Arendt and Scully, among others.
